snippet: The 2015 spending bill is weighted with some of the most devious and damaging provisions imaginable for good government.
abstract: Editorial decries House's passage of 2015 spending bill containing two riders aimed at appeasing moneyed donors, as well as collection of other regressive moves; notes that first rider allows huge increase in allowable size of political donations, while second kills crucial part of Dodd-Frank reform law aimed at curbing banks’ reckless speculation in complex derivatives; holds that bills are damaging to both good government and tax payers.
lead_paragraph: The 2015 spending bill is weighted with some of the most devious and damaging provisions imaginable for good government.
